name: Marriott Portland City Center

reviews.title: A great choice in Downtown Portland
reviews.text: I just returned from three nights at this hotel and found the reviews on TA pretty accurate. Everyone was exceptionally friendly and helpful. My room, on the concierge level, was $225 inc. tax. The breakfast was included at the private lounge on the 20th floor. Excellent service there. Stop by during the day for free beverages and at night for desert, cheese, or freshly baked cookies. If you use it, it's worth the extra $20 a night.
Room 1813 was very clean and the bed is as comfy as others have said. Linens are high quality. Bathroom is on the small side but fine. Even though I was close to the elevator, I never heard it.

reviews.text: Parking is pricey ($24/night), but the valets were great and always had my car waiting when I called in advance. Once reviewer recommended using the parking structures on either side of the hotel to save money. Good idea!

reviews.title: Excellent location, very comfortable room

reviews.text: November 29, 2005 – December 1, 2005 – This was my second stay at the Portland (Oregon) Marriott City Center. I hope to return to this hotel when in Portland.
reviews.title: Convenient, Comfortable, Friendly, City Center Hotel

reviews.text: We had a comfortable weekend stay at the hotel. Very convenient location in the middle of the city, safe walking around to restaurants etc in the evening (but careful walking to Chinatown at night!). Rooms were nicely furnished. Views were typical urban scenery mainly of the building across the street. Our particular room had a problematic shower that was quickly fixed the next morning. Overall, very satisfactory and up to Marriott standards. To save 60% on parking, self-park in the garage next door instead of valet-park.
reviews.title: Central location, comfortable rooms
Great Room - Comfy!
reviews.text: My wife and I took the MAX train from the airport, which dropped us 2 blocks from the Marriott. We had an 11th floor deluxe King room which I think is their standard. The website shows a deluxe King room that's situated on the front corner of the building with a curved window. These rooms a "premium" and require advanced booking. I knew I would be getting a standard room from the reviews I read, so I wasn't disappointed. The room was very nice, clean, and had a great bed and shower. There was a nice chair & ottoman in the room that was incredibly comfy. Also had a desk, and TV cabinet - no refrigerator. The bed had a very soft "pillow top" which was a little on the soft side, but still flat and very comfy. Warm colors with nice wallpaper, and perfectly clean. The bathroom was a little small but clean and nicely appointed. The room was extremely quiet.

The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room on the 11th floor had ok views, but looking straight out (west), our view was the top of the building across the street. A much higher or lower view would probably be better, as you would see the face of the building instead of the roof. Rooms facing north would have better views, as would the premium corner rooms. There were restaurants and shopping all directions within easy walking distance, and there is a Rite Aid right around the corner. There is no need to rent a car if visiting the downtown area - it's very people friendly with free busses, trolleys and light rail (MAX).
reviews.title: Well Run, Good Service, Great Value

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed over the 4th of July holiday weekend. The staff were helpful and very service-oriented, especially room service. We opted for a corner room and landed one on the 17th floor, providing great panoramic views to the west for sunset, and to the north for Mt. St. Helens. The bed and linens were as nice as advertised. The location is convenient to the highways, and is within short walks of many high-quality restaurants and stores. Overall, the value for money was superior to that of more expensive properties in other cities; this hotel probably compares very well with similar hotels in Portland.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Would definitely stay again
reviews.text: We checked in late night and requested to have a room with 2 beds and no issues with that. Check-in was a bit slow but that's alright, they were very detailed in explaining the hotel amenities. We got a room on the 9th floor and the room was just fantastic! Just what we needed from our long road trip in Vancouver, BC. There was no view at all, our window overlooked other buildings instead, maybe we got this room cuz we booked our reservation through priceline?! Don't know.

I've stayed at the Portland Marriott City Center twice in the past month and found it to be a very pleasant surprise. The staff at the door, desk, restaurant and room service were all very friendly and pleasant. The rooms are nice, and in good condition. My perception was that the non-suite rooms were just a little smaller than a typical Marriott room, maybe just 5% smaller. But it may have just been the layout that made it seem that way. On previous visits I have regularly stayed at the Heathman but we found this to offer many of the benefits of the Heathman for roughly half the price. The location is hard to beat because it so central to the light rail, shopping and downtown neighborhoods. Room service was very fast and fairly priced.
reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
Love the Marriott City Center!
reviews.text: My husband's family lives outside of Portland so occassionally we stay at the Marriott City Center. You can't beat the $99/night during the weekend. Valet is a lot($23) and we read about complaints from people finding their cars on the street, (sometimes even unlocked). We park at the Smart Park by the Pioneer Place mall, which is about 2 blocks away. Most stores will validate. One time we stayed for 2 nights and our parking the whole time came to $13. The rooms are nice, the bar is good (for a hotel bar), the buffet is great, and I LOVE the fitness room. It's also a block from Nordstrom's (my favorite!) and next to Peet's coffee. We walked everywhere so it was nice to not use our car. I definitely recommend this hotel - we've stayed here about 8 times and have never had a bad experience. Plus, when you shop downtown there is no tax!!! One time we took the train down (which was okay, not sure if I would do it again. It took 4 hours from Tukwila because it was stopped for 30 min. in vancouver each way). Our father-in-law picked us up when we arrived and he left his car in the valet area for 15 minutes and they were really nice about it. On our way out of town we walked to the train station - its 12 blocks from the hotel. We needed the exercise since we pretty much sit in cubicles all day!

My wife and I booked a room at the Marriott for a few days in early December. We chose it for its great central location. We had not been to Portland before, and wanted to be able to walk/bus to many local attractions. It certainly fulfilled all of our expectations.
reviews.title: Great downtown location!

reviews.text: We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant one night, and breakfast every morning. The service was always very attentive and friendly. They always gave a table by the windows if one was available. That was nice because I liked looking out at the city, which I found aesthetically appealling, especially at night.
reviews.title: Worth The Stay, We Will Return
Portland Town Center Marriott is great!
reviews.text: The only downside of the trip was that we both came down with colds, but we certainly don't hold that against the hotel.

description: Located in the heart of the Rose City, the Marriott Portland City Center on Broadway allows guests to tap into the pulse of Portland s most enchanting urban rhythms. Boasting the city's best location our hotel is a travelers delight. Centrally located to the business district, shopping, restaurants and convenient to MAX Light rail we have it all! Whether traveling for business or pleasure, we have everything you need for the perfect stay. Green Seal Certified.
